answers.answer: i not sure if you are a male or female.my husband has all of your symptoms it sounds exactly the same his doc is baffled all the same bloods done for lymes and arthritis thyroid etc fybromyalgia not yet ruled out and his next step is testing for cystic fibrosis.i just think we all work too hard burning the candle at both ends.stress can manfest itself in all sorts of ways.imy husband and i are 38 and are recently feeling the creking factor kicking in lately.good luckx

Check this link out and see if it can be of any assistance. Most of your symptoms seem to match the ones listed here, and my guess is the stress/anxiety about them and what the cause could be is only intensifying the pain and discomfort.http://www.wisegeek.com/what-is-premenopause.htm

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Unexplained aches and pains could be due to fibromyalgia, chronic fatigue syndrome, rheumatoid arthritis, lupus, Crohn’s disease, H pylori infection, anemia, liver disorders, diabetes, hypothyroidism, Vit B12 or Vit D deficiency and due to calcium or magnesium deficiency. This needs a comprehensive investigation. Consult a doctor please. Take care!

question: I just turned 40, I don’t drink, don’t smoke, lowered soda/caffeine consumption to 2-3 sodas/cups of coffee a day and eat well.For the past 3 months I have had a mixture of the following symptoms and cannot find a trigger.  I have had every blood test except RMF, Lyme and West Nile.  All have been negative.  Ibuprofen does not help.  My Dr. doesn’t have any suggestions for further diagnostics or treatment.  I found the ‘tender point’ test for Fibromyalgia but really didn’t fall into that category either.I am tired of being in pain.  Here are my symptoms:joint paintendon pain (one knee an my shoulders are horrible)muscle aches (all of my muscles are tight - this has always been a problem)feverish (skin sensitivity)headaches ( I take migraine meds before seeing if they turn into full blown migraines)nauseaeye irritation, glossy, red all of the timetrouble focusing (in terms of my vision)memory losshot flashes before sleepingAny advice appreciated!Thanks!
title: Could use some advice- Just beginning to research the cause of my symptoms
